headline: Four Books Sound the Alarm About the Power of Private Equity
summary: Firms such as  Apollo Global Management  and  Blackstone  are arguing in Washington that when turmoil strikes public markets, Americans would be better off investing in their private-equity and private-credit funds.  Critics say that the firms are turning to the “retail” market because they have tapped out big pension funds—and that private markets are a bad fit for individual savers.  Alternative-investment companies already deploy money for pension systems and the uberwealthy in private equity, private credit, infrastructure, hedge funds and technology venture capital.
